Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student may draw a basic shape resembling a fish, but without details.
The student might attempt to label a body of water as the habitat, like 'lake' or 'ocean', but could be inconsistent in identifying it correctly.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to accurately draw and label different plants or animals that live in the same habitat as the fish (student may only draw the fish).
The student might not show or label any resources the fish needs, such as water or plants (student doesn’t know this).
The student is unlikely to illustrate how the habitat provides necessary resources for the fish or other living things (student doesn’t understand the relationship).
The student might not represent any relationships between the fish and its resources or how they form a system (student doesn’t understand how the system works).
